channel.title: Drop dupe
channel.description:
Hello, much as the title leads you to believe, we are having a issue with a 'drop dupe'. This works with items such as equipables and raw food while you are cooking it on a range(how we originally found the bug).
[b]To cause this bug you do the following..[/b] Example for cooking: - Take for example a raw lobster - Use it on the range, and immediatly, before the lobster is cooked, you got to right-click it and press drop. - Now you will have 1 lobster in your ivetory, and one on the flour
This also can be done with equiping things, but then you need to press equip inplace of drop.
We have tried putting a drop timer on after any action but this did not seem to help. We also tried booting a player if they wear a item then drop a item, this worked as long as you weren't fast.
If you know how to fix this problem, please post in this topic or contact look2kid@hotmail.com
Thx, VbCoder

item.title: Drop dupe
item.dc:creator: @Endacia-Online Endacia-Online
item.description:
@Endacia-Online wrote:

durial12:

Look for the drop method and add a timer after the equip method has been run.

That is what I just said we are trying to do. We told equipping an item to be an action, that worked great! We actually fixed it, kind of…

Now we are getting the following problem. If you just keep the right click menu open for longer then 10 seconds you can drop the item and it dupes…

What we have to far:

[code]case 87:
// drop item
int droppedItem = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
somejunk = inStream.readUnsignedByte()

  • inStream.readUnsignedByte();
    int slot = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
    // println_debug("dropItem: “+droppedItem+” Slot: "+slot);
    if (wearing == false && System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction < 3000){
    lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
    sM(“Fail.”);
    } else if (wearing == false && System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction > 3000) {
    dropItem(droppedItem, slot);
    sM(“Dropped.”);
    }
    break;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Drop dupe
item.dc:creator: @Endacia-Online Endacia-Online
item.description:
@Endacia-Online wrote:

Update:
We were trying to use ‘lastAction’.
Unfortunately wielding a item is not counted as a action so this will not work.
We are currently trying to start a timer when you wear an item then tell the game not to drop unless its been 1 second since wielding an item. Does anyone have a quick idea on how to go about this?

Read full topic

item.title: Drop dupe
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

I’ve just look through an old source, and it seems to have some sort of dupe finder. THIS IS NOT MINE, it belongs to runefreak10, I believe therefore don’t say it’s yours (or mine).

[code]public void ScanItems() {
//MADE BY BILL

    for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) {

        if ((bankItems[i] == 1039 || bankItems[i] == 1041

                || bankItems[i] == 1043  || bankItems[i] == 1045

                || bankItems[i] == 1047  || bankItems[i] == 1049

	    || bankItems[i] == 1051  || bankItems[i] == 1054

	    || bankItems[i] == 1056  || bankItems[i] == 1058

	    || bankItems[i] == 15335 || bankItems[i] == 15337

	    || bankItems[i] == 15196 || bankItems[i] == 15186

	    || bankItems[i] == 3141  || bankItems[i] == 5699

	    || bankItems[i] == 6571  || bankItems[i] == 6570)

                && bankItemsN[i] >= 30) {

            saveasflagged();

        }

    }

    for (int i2 = 0; i2 < playerItems.length; i2++) {

        if ((playerItems[i2] == 1038 || playerItems[i2] == 1040

                || playerItems[i2] == 1042  || playerItems[i2] == 1044

                || playerItems[i2] == 1046  || playerItems[i2] == 1048

                || playerItems[i2] == 1050  || playerItems[i2] == 1053

                || playerItems[i2] == 1055  || playerItems[i2] == 1057

                || playerItems[i2] == 15334 || playerItems[i2] == 15336

	    || playerItems[i2] == 15195 || playerItems[i2] == 15185

	    || playerItems[i2] == 3140  || playerItems[i2] == 5698

	    || playerItems[i2] == 6570)

                && playerItemsN[i] >= 20) {

            saveasflagged();

        }

    }



    for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) {

        if (bankItems[i] == 996 && bankItemsN[i] >= 1000000000) {

            saveasflagged();

        }

    }

    for (int i2 = 0; i2 < playerItems.length; i2++) {

        if (playerItems[i2] == 996 && playerItemsN[i2] >= 1000000000) {

            saveasflagged();

        }

    }



}



public void deleteObject(int objectX, int objectY) {

    outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(60);

    outStream.writeByte(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));

    outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));



    /* DELETE OBJECT*/

    outStream.writeByte(101);

    outStream.writeByteC(0);

    outStream.writeByte(0);

}

[/code]

After you have added this somewhere suitable into your client.java add this somewhere about where the messages for people logging in are.

For example:

if (player.Rights >= 2) sendMessage(" + playername +, welcome back!")

It will look something like that, so just search for it.

Put this underneath all of those

ScanItems();

This will run the method you just added, which by the looks of it scans for multiple rare items. Give it a try, if you don’t like it, don’t use it.

100% credits to runefreak10 for all of that btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Drop dupe
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.description:
@VbCoder wrote:

Hello, much as the title leads you to believe, we are having a issue with a ‘drop dupe’. This works with items such as equipables and raw food while you are cooking it on a range(how we originally found the bug).

To cause this bug you do the following…
Example for cooking:

  • Take for example a raw lobster
  • Use it on the range, and immediatly, before the lobster is cooked, you got to right-click it and press drop.
  • Now you will have 1 lobster in your ivetory, and one on the flour

This also can be done with equiping things, but then you need to press equip inplace of drop.

We have tried putting a drop timer on after any action but this did not seem to help. We also tried booting a player if they wear a item then drop a item, this worked as long as you weren’t fast.

If you know how to fix this problem, please post in this topic or contact look2kid@hotmail.com

Thx, VbCoder

Read full topic
